events.message: The insured reported a car accident involving rear-end collision resulting in vehicle damage.
After reviewing the initial report, the claim was categorized under Auto Accident for proper handling.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle the claim and contacted the claimant for further details.
The claim was formally acknowledged and the claimant was informed about the next steps.
Requested police report, repair estimates, and photos of the damaged vehicle from the claimant.
The claimant submitted all requested documents including official police report and repair quotes.
A formal investigation into the accident details was initiated to assess damages and liability.
The investigation confirmed the claimant was not at fault and damage estimates were validated.
A fair settlement offer covering all repair costs was proposed and communicated to the claimant.
The claimant expressed satisfaction with the settlement offer and commended prompt handling.
The claim was officially approved for the agreed settlement amount after claimant's acceptance.
Payment covering all damages was issued to the claimantâ€™s bank account as per agreement.
Following issuance of payment, the claim was formally closed and all case files archived.
All records and documentation related to the claim were archived in the insurance system.
